briefdescription.para: Under Unix this macro changes the current process umask to the given value, unless it is equal to -1 in which case nothing is done, and restores it to the original value on scope exit.

detaileddescription.para: It works by declaring a variable which sets umask to mask in its constructor and restores it in its destructor. Under other platforms this macro expands to nothing.

briefdescription.para: Standard POSIX names for these permission flags with "wx" prefix.
Standard POSIX names for these permission flags with "wx" prefix.
Standard POSIX names for these permission flags with "wx" prefix.

Default mode for the new files: allow reading/writing them to everybody but the effective file mode will be set after ANDing this value with umask and so won't include wxS_IW{GRP,OTH} for the default 022 umask value.

enumvalue.name: wxS_DIR_DEFAULT
enumvalue.initializer: (wxPOSIX_USER_READ | wxPOSIX_USER_WRITE | wxPOSIX_USER_EXECUTE | wxPOSIX_GROUP_READ | wxPOSIX_GROUP_WRITE | wxPOSIX_GROUP_EXECUTE | wxPOSIX_OTHERS_READ | wxPOSIX_OTHERS_WRITE | wxPOSIX_OTHERS_EXECUTE)

briefdescription.para: Default mode for the new directories (see wxFileName::Mkdir): allow reading/writing/executing them to everybody, but just like wxS_DEFAULT the effective directory mode will be set after ANDing this value with umask.
File permission bit names.

detaileddescription.para: We define these constants in wxWidgets because S_IREAD &c are not standard. However, we do assume that the values correspond to the Unix umask bits.

briefdescription.para: Seek from the file beginning.
Seek from the current position.
Seek from end of the file.
Parameter indicating how file offset should be interpreted.

detaileddescription.para: This is used by wxFFile::Seek() and wxFile::Seek().

briefdescription.para: Unknown file kind, or unable to determine.
A file supporting seeking to arbitrary offsets.
A tty.
A pipe.
File kind enumerations returned from wxGetFileKind().

detaileddescription.para: Also used by wxFFile::GetKind() and wxFile::GetKind().

briefdescription.para: The type used to store and provide byte offsets or byte sizes for files or streams.

detaileddescription.para: It is type-defined as off_t on POSIX platforms (see http://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/File-Position-Primitive.html) or to wxLongLong_t on Windows when wxHAS_HUGE_FILES is defined.

briefdescription.para: A special return value of many wxWidgets classes to indicate that an invalid offset was given.
This function returns the total number of bytes and number of free bytes on the disk containing the directory path (it should exist).

detaileddescription.para: Both total and free parameters may be NULL if the corresponding information is not needed.

2.3.2
The generic Unix implementation depends on the system having the statfs() or statvfs() function.
true on success, false if an error occurred (for example, the directory doesnâ€™t exist). Include file: #include <wx/filefn.h>

briefdescription.para: Returns the Windows directory under Windows; other platforms return an empty string.
Parses the wildCard, returning the number of filters.

detaileddescription.para: Returns 0 if none or if there's a problem.

The arrays will contain an equal number of items found before the error. On platforms where native dialogs handle only one filter per entry, entries in arrays are automatically adjusted. wildCard is in the form:

briefdescription.para: Converts a DOS to a Unix filename by replacing backslashes with forward slashes.

xrefdescription.para: Construct a wxFileName with wxPATH_DOS and then use wxFileName::GetFullPath(wxPATH_UNIX) instead.

briefdescription.para: Converts a Unix to a DOS filename by replacing forward slashes with backslashes.

xrefdescription.para: Construct a wxFileName with wxPATH_UNIX and then use wxFileName::GetFullPath(wxPATH_DOS) instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if dirname exists and is a directory.

xrefdescription.para: This function is obsolete, please use wxFileName::SplitPath() instead.

detaileddescription.para: This function splits a full file name into components: the path (including possible disk/drive specification under Windows), the base name, and the extension. Any of the output parameters (path, name or ext) may be NULL if you are not interested in the value of a particular component.

wxSplitPath() will correctly handle filenames with both DOS and Unix path separators under Windows, however it will not consider backslashes as path separators under Unix (where backslash is a valid character in a filename).
On entry, fullname should be non-NULL (it may be empty though).

On return, path contains the file path (without the trailing separator), name contains the file name and ext contains the file extension without leading dot. All three of them may be empty if the corresponding component is. The old contents of the strings pointed to by these parameters will be overwritten in any case (if the pointers are not NULL).

briefdescription.para: Returns time of last modification of given file.

detaileddescription.para: The function returns (time_t)-1 if an error occurred (e.g. file not found).

briefdescription.para: Renames file1 to file2, returning true if successful.

detaileddescription.para: If file2 is a directory, file1 is moved into it (overwrite is ignored in this case). Otherwise, if file2 is an existing file, it is overwritten if overwrite is true (default) and the function fails if overwrite is false.

briefdescription.para: Copies file1 to file2, returning true if successful.

detaileddescription.para: If overwrite parameter is true (default), the destination file is overwritten if it exists, but if overwrite is false, the functions fails in this case.
This function supports resources forks under Mac OS.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the file exists and is a plain file.
Returns true if the pattern matches the text; if dot_special is true, filenames beginning with a dot are not matched with wildcard characters.

xrefdescription.para: This function is deprecated, use wxGetCwd() instead.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the current working directory into the buffer if supplied, or copies the working directory into new storage (which you must delete yourself) if the buffer is NULL.
sz is the size of the buffer if supplied.

briefdescription.para: Returns the directory part of the filename.
Returns true if the pattern contains wildcards.
Returns true if the argument is an absolute filename, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: with a slash or drive name at the beginning.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string containing the current (or working) directory.
Sets the current working directory, returning true if the operation succeeded.

detaileddescription.para: Under MS Windows, the current drive is also changed if dir contains a drive specification.

briefdescription.para: Concatenates file1 and file2 to file3, returning true if successful.
Removes file, returning true if successful.
Makes the directory dir, returning true if successful.

detaileddescription.para: perm is the access mask for the directory for the systems on which it is supported (Unix) and doesn't have any effect on the other ones.

briefdescription.para: Removes the directory dir, returning true if successful.

detaileddescription.para: The flags parameter is reserved for future use.

There is also a wxRmDir() function which simply wraps the standard POSIX rmdir() function and so return an integer error code instead of a boolean value (but otherwise is currently identical to wxRmdir()), don't confuse these two functions. Include file: #include <wx/filefn.h>

briefdescription.para: Returns the next file that matches the path passed to wxFindFirstFile().
This function does directory searching; returns the first file that matches the path spec, or the empty string.

detaileddescription.para: Use wxFindNextFile() to get the next matching file. Neither will report the current directory "." or the parent directory "..".
As of 2.5.2, these functions are not thread-safe! (they use static variables). You probably want to use wxDir::GetFirst() or wxDirTraverser instead. spec may contain wildcards.
flags may be wxDIR for restricting the query to directories, wxFILE for files or zero for either.

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of an open file.

detaileddescription.para: Possible return values are enumerations of wxFileKind.

xrefdescription.para: This function is obsolete, please use wxFileName::SplitPath() instead.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the filename for a full path. The second form returns a pointer to temporary storage that should not be deallocated.

xrefdescription.para: This function is obsolete, please use wxFileName::CreateTempFileName() instead.
